etymology.description: 告(告) (gào, "inform") + 别(別) (bié, "leave; part") = say goodbye; farewell
etymology.interpretation: The word 告别(告別) (gàobié, "say goodbye; farewell") consists of 告(告) (gào, "inform") and 别(別) (bié, "leave; part"). When you 'inform' someone about a 'parting,' you are essentially saying goodbye. This concept is relevant in both personal departures and formal farewells.

examples.chinese: 他在码头告别(他在碼頭告別)，依依不舍地离去(依依不舍地離去)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài mǎtóu gàobié, yīyī bùshě dì líqù.
examples.english: He said farewell at the dock and left reluctantly.

examples.chinese: 朋友聚会后告别(朋友聚會後告别)，彼此期待重逢(彼此期待重逢)。
examples.pinyin: Péngyǒu jùhuì hòu gàobié, bǐcǐ qídài chóngféng.
examples.english: After the gathering, friends said farewell, each looking forward to reuniting.
